block.p: Stephanie Donna Benzaquen, a daughter of Jennifer Pinto Safian and Norman S. Benzaquen, both of New York, is to be married this evening to Stephen Ashe Levey, a son of Leslee F. Levey and Lewis A. Levey of St. Louis. Rabbi Marc D. Angel will officiate at the Pierre in New York.
The couple graduated from Princeton, the bride cum laude and the bridegroom magna cum laude.

Stephanie Donna Benzaquen, a daughter of Jennifer Pinto Safian and Norman S. Benzaquen, both of New York, is to be married this evening to Stephen Ashe Levey, a son of Leslee F. Levey and Lewis A. Levey of St. Louis. Rabbi Marc D. Angel will officiate at the Pierre in New York.
The couple graduated from Princeton, the bride cum laude and the bridegroom magna cum laude.

The bride, 24, received a master's degree in clinical psychology in May from New York University, where she is now a doctoral student in that subject. Her father is a managing partner in Gilder, Gagnon & Howe, an investment firm in New York. Her mother is an art dealer in New York, specializing in modern European painting and sculpture. The bride is a stepdaughter of A. Chester Safian.

The bridegroom, 26, is an editorial associate at Vanity Fair magazine in New York. His father, a founder of Paragon Group, a real estate investment trust in Dallas, is a director of Camden Property Trust of Houston, which acquired Paragon.
